intro: Glaux densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered glaux, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and alternate, often covered in fine hairs. Glaux densiflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wet meadows and along stream banks.
